revised_title: The Effects of the Extraordinary Heat in July 1757 and Its Health Consequences
tldr: In a letter to William Watson, John Huxham, M.D., F.R.S., describes the excessive heat in July 1757 and its effects on human health. He reports cases of hemorrhages, fevers, and other health issues related to the heat. Huxham also discusses the treatment methods used during that time.
